newsitem.title: POLAND: LDA plans new share, bond issue.
newsitem.headline: LDA plans new share, bond issue.

text.p: Polish printing house Lodzka Drukarnia Akcydensowa (LDA) plans a new issue of between 1,193,060 and 1,926,500 shares and a convertible bond issue, the company said in a statement on Thursday.

It said between 650,000 and 1,383,440 of the new issue would be offered as one-for-one rights and the remaining 543,060 as registered one-for-two rights for those shareholders who currently hold registered shares.
It said the registered shares issue price would be two zlotys each and the common shares would be offered at 50 percent of LDA's market price on a session before record day.

It said it also wanted to issue 1,000 three-year convertible bonds at a nominal value of 10,000 zlotys. It said the issue was aimed at forming capital links with other companies, but did not give details.
The management's proposals on the issues will be voted on at the LDA shareholders meeting on May 16.
